posts.post_content: Oh man, Ash Zealot. She's almost perfect in terms of abilities. 2/2 first strike haste is incredible, of course, and that flashback-hosing ability is pretty sweet. But that's the one thing I would change... see how it says "Whenever a *player*..."? If it read "Whenever an *opponent*..." she would be just that much better. Why? Funny you should ask. [Past in Flames](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Past in Flames) comes to mind. Then again, it's not like we needed to make [Guttersnipe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guttersnipe) any better. Expect this card to be a staple in RDW. 5/5

Posted By: RetroGamer3 (12/3/2012 5:23:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is good. Compare to [Blood Knight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood Knight). While the ability to hose white decks is very good against well, heavy white decks, flashback hate hoses, **a lot** of degenerate strategies and affects **a lot** of decks. Not only that, but, in burn, this card can get in for very early damage which [Keldon Marauders](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Keldon Marauders) and [Blood Knight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood Knight) cannot. Also, against control and other spell heavy decks, this brings the beatdown. Very well rounded, and could see play in Burn, RDW, and maybe even be in sideboards. I don't know whether or not you would play this over [Hellspark Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hellspark Elemental)s in burn, I still am going to playtest with this. The fact that it has First Strike (Good for stalling the board/beating down if you have pumps) AND Haste (early beatdown is very very good in burn) makes it playable on it's own even without the third ability.
posts.html:
This card is good. Compare to Blood Knight. While the ability to hose white decks is very good against well, heavy white decks, flashback hate hoses, a lot of degenerate strategies and affects a lot of decks. Not only that, but, in burn, this card can get in for very early damage which Keldon Marauders and Blood Knight cannot. Also, against control and other spell heavy decks, this brings the beatdown. Very well rounded, and could see play in Burn, RDW, and maybe even be in sideboards. I don't know whether or not you would play this over Hellspark Elementals in burn, I still am going to playtest with this. The fact that it has First Strike (Good for stalling the board/beating down if you have pumps) AND Haste (early beatdown is very very good in burn) makes it playable on it's own even without the third ability.

posts.post_content:
A 2cc for a creature with haste is good enough, and she has first strike too to make her a staple in a red deck. With Innistrad still around, most players will sometimes forget her third ability and eat a mace for casting a flashback card.  
  
Though do remember that it's "each player" and not "each opponent". You won't want her to swing at you for flashbacking a [Faithless Looting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=245299).
posts.html:
A 2cc for a creature with haste is good enough, and she has first strike too to make her a staple in a red deck. With Innistrad still around, most players will sometimes forget her third ability and eat a mace for casting a flashback card.

Though do remember that it's "each player" and not "each opponent". You won't want her to swing at you for flashbacking a Faithless Looting.

Posted By: Continue (11/13/2012 8:43:24 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Stoneforge Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stoneforge Mystic)  
[Snapcaster Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snapcaster Mage)  
[Dark Confidant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Confidant)  
[Ash Zealot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ash Zealot)  
[Tarmogoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tarmogoyf)  
  
I think the cycle is now complete. The Red one is not the strongest- but it's strong enough against the others. I don't expect to get any more than this in Red.  
  
EDIT: Yes, the Red one is very weak by comparison. But it's still CMC = 2. And think about this:  
R&D "didn't realise" that Tower of [Calamities](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Calamities)' predecessors were a cycle until we started wanting them to be, so they made Tower of Calamities. We are going to see the same thing with the Red one, I'm sure, but...  
  
WoTC doesn't make broken cards deliberately. And, shocking though it may seem, Stoneforge, 'Goyf, and Snapcaster were all MISTAKES. As in, Wizards didn't want them to be that powerful. I haven't got enough research on R&D's opinion of Bob, beyond acknowledging simply that he's powerful. I do NOT think Wizards will ever delibera... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
